reasons_to_visit.details: Enjoy milder spring temperatures compared to winter, with long daylight hours (around 17 hours by mid-May) perfect for exploring the city and region.
Experience Stavanger's lively May 17th celebrations. Witness parades, traditional 'bunad' costumes, marching bands, and a festive atmosphere throughout the city center and harbor area.
May often marks the beginning of the hiking season for iconic trails like Preikestolen (Pulpit Rock), offering breathtaking fjord views (check conditions beforehand, especially early May).
See the coastal landscape come alive with spring blooms. Consider a boat trip to the unique island garden of Flor & Fjære (opens in May).
Outside the May 17th period, enjoy slightly fewer crowds and potentially better availability compared to peak summer months (July/August).
Take a scenic cruise into the stunning Lysefjord, getting close to waterfalls and potentially seeing Preikestolen from below.

reasons_to_reconsider.details: While milder than the north, Stavanger's coastal weather in May can be unpredictable. Expect a mix of sunshine, cloud, wind, and rain showers. Pack layers and waterproofs.
Constitution Day brings large crowds to the city center. Accommodation and flights around this date are more expensive and require early booking. Many shops are closed on May 17th.

While lower trails are clear, higher elevation hikes like Pulpit Rock or Kjerag (road often opens late May/June) can still have snow patches or wet conditions early in the month. Check trail status and requirements.
May 1st (Labor Day), May 17th, Ascension Day (variable), and possibly Pentecost/Whit Monday (variable) are public holidays with potential shop and attraction closures or reduced hours. Check dates.
Despite being spring, average temperatures are cool (around 6-13°C / 43-56°F). Warm clothing, including layers and a wind/waterproof jacket, is still necessary.

weather.precipitation: Moderate chance of rain showers (average 34% chance daily for May overall). Coastal weather can change quickly. Expect sunshine, clouds, and wind.
weather.general_tips: Pack layers (fleece, thermal base), a waterproof/windproof jacket, comfortable walking shoes (waterproof recommended). Sunglasses useful for bright days. No snow expected at sea level.

tourism_level.crowds: Moderate shoulder season, increasing towards mid-month. Busy around May 1st holiday.
tourism_level.pricing: Shoulder season prices, but book ahead especially for May 1st weekend and approaching May 17th.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Spring awakening. City feels fresh, daylight increasing rapidly. Outdoor cafes start opening up. Good time for city exploration before peak season.

events_holidays.name: May Day / Labor Day (Første mai)
events_holidays.description: Public holiday. Check for potential local events or parades.

events_holidays.name: Ascension Day (Kristi Himmelfartsdag) (If applicable)
events_holidays.date: Varies (Thursday, 40 days after Easter - often early/mid May)
events_holidays.description: Public holiday, may create a long weekend.

unique_experiences.description: Wander through charming cobbled streets lined with beautifully preserved 18th/19th-century white wooden houses.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Best explored on foot. Wear comfortable shoes. Can be combined with a harbour visit.

unique_experiences.activity: Visit the Norwegian Petroleum Museum (Norsk Oljemuseum)
unique_experiences.description: Learn about Norway's significant oil and gas industry through interactive exhibits. Interesting architecture.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Good indoor activity for a rainy day. Allow 2-3 hours.

unique_experiences.description: Enjoy the vibrant atmosphere of the city's main harbour, see boats, and check out the colourful buildings ('Fargegaten' - Øvre Holmegate nearby).
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Lots of cafes and restaurants nearby. Can be windy.

unique_experiences.activity: See Swords in Rock (Sverd i fjell)
unique_experiences.description: Visit the striking monument of three large bronze swords commemorating the Battle of Hafrsfjord in 872.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Accessible by local bus. Located by the fjord, can be exposed to wind.

weather.precipitation: Similar chance of rain as first half, potentially slightly milder days but still variable coastal weather. Long daylight hours (approaching longest days).
weather.general_tips: Continue with layers and waterproofs. Sunscreen can be useful on sunny days due to long daylight.

tourism_level.crowds: EXTREMELY high around May 17th. Quieter immediately after, then building towards June high season.
tourism_level.pricing: Peak prices for May 17th period. High season pricing may start applying. Book far ahead.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Dominated by May 17th celebrations early on. Generally feels more summery with very long days.

events_holidays.name: Norway's Constitution Day (Syttende Mai)
events_holidays.description: Major celebration with parades (children's, citizen's 'folketog'), bunader, marching bands, flags. Very festive atmosphere centered downtown and around the harbour.
events_holidays.notes: Public holiday. Most shops closed. City center extremely crowded. Book accommodation far in advance.

events_holidays.name: Ascension Day / Pentecost (If applicable)
events_holidays.description: Potential public holidays affecting shop/service availability.
events_holidays.notes: Verify dates if traveling during this period.

unique_experiences.description: Join the celebrations, watch the parades, admire traditional costumes (bunader), listen to bands, and soak up the national day spirit.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Arrive early for parade viewing spots. Dress in layers. Be prepared for closures and crowds. Enjoy the festive food stalls.

unique_experiences.where: Requires ferry and bus/car from Stavanger
unique_experiences.description: Embark on the iconic hike to the famous cliff plateau overlooking the Lysefjord. Typically a 4-5 hour round trip hike.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Check trail status (pulpitrock.no / UT.no) beforehand - may still have wet/snowy sections. Proper hiking boots essential. Bring water/snacks. Start early.

unique_experiences.description: Enjoy a boat trip through the dramatic Lysefjord, seeing waterfalls (like Hengjanefossen), fjord farms, and Pulpit Rock from sea level.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Several companies operate tours (e.g., Rødne). Book in advance. Dress warmly even on nice days as it's colder on the water.

unique_experiences.description: Explore a unique, man-made exotic garden that thrives surprisingly far north. Includes boat trip and often a meal.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Seasonal opening (usually starts mid-May). Must be pre-booked as a package (boat+garden+food). Pricey but unique.
